page.title: 04Mollington Buildings Part 2
page.content: There have been some minor property developments over the past 20 years,the largest being the "new"estate of{Chestnut Road}.This is a group of 50 houses built around 1960 to re-house the families,moving jobs from Birmingham to Banbury,with Birds Custard Ltd,now General Foods Ltd. Interestingly,considerable relaxation of planning permission was allowed and the Green Belt conservation rules relaxed in order to bring prosperity to the area.Non of the properties are built in local stone but a light clay brick with timber cladding.This has reduced the average house price and enabled younger first time buyers,to come into the village,giving it new blood and keeping the local school alive.
